articles.description: While cases of severe illness and death remain far more rare among pediatric patients than adults, tens of thousands of children may struggle with its effects.
articles.content: JERUSALEM – One month after her son Eran had recovered from a mild case of COVID-19, Sara Bittan rushed the 3-year-old to the emergency room. He had a high fever, a rash, his eyes and lower body were… [+5010 chars]

articles.title: A new report shows worrying growth of the diabetes pandemic - News24
articles.description: These are important steps towards addressing the continued and rapid rise of diabetes prevalence, particularly in countries that do not have a national diabetes plan or coverage for essential health services.
articles.content: Diabetes is rising at an alarming rate. One in 10 adults worldwide – 537 million people – now live with the disease. This is higher than the 463 million adults who lived with the condition in 2019. I… [+4826 chars]
